summary: The Art Market Integrity Act amends title 31 of the United States Code to subject certain art traders to regulations regarding records and reports on monetary instrument transactions. It defines "work of art" and exempts certain art market participants based on transaction value and volume. The bill mandates updated Treasury guidance on high-value artwork transactions involving sanctioned individuals and requires the Secretary of the Treasury to issue proposed rules to implement the amendments. It also includes technical and conforming amendments to the Anti-Money Laundering Act of 2020.
